Text: The 2020 Mean PM2.5 Regional concentration 2016 in Cook County, Illinois, (which is the closest county in your area that collects such data), was 8.087607524, which is higher than the state average of 0.0318409745039, according to The Washington Post. Within the state, Cook County, Illinois has the rank highest Mean PM2.5 Regional concentration 2016, and it is on the 63 percentile in the country.
Title: Mean PM2.5 concentration levels in Cook County, Illinois
